data.title: 88 Notable Alumni of the Dresden University of Technology
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 88 notable alumni from the Dresden University of Technology sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
88 Notable alumni of

Dresden University of Technology

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

The Dresden University of Technology is 783rd in the world, 276th in Europe, and 36th in Germany by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 88 notable alumni from the Dresden University of Technology sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Heinrich Hertz

Born in

Germany

Years

1857-1894 (aged 37)

Occupations

physicistinventoruniversity teacherphilosopher

Biography

Heinrich Rudolf Hertz was a German physicist who first conclusively proved the existence of the electromagnetic waves predicted by James Clerk Maxwell's equations of electromagnetism. The unit of frequency, cycle per second, was named the "hertz" in his honor.

Adolf Loos

Born in

Czech Republic

Years

1870-1933 (aged 63)

Occupations

writerarchitectdesignerteacherart theorist

Biography

Adolf Franz Karl Viktor Maria Loos was an Austrian and Czechoslovak architect, influential European theorist, and a polemicist of modern architecture. He was inspired by modernism and a widely-known critic of the Art Nouveau movement. His controversial views and literary contributions sparked the establishment of the Vienna Secession movement and postmodernism.

Maria Reich

Born in

Germany

Years

1903-1998 (aged 95)

Occupations

language teacherarchaeologistmathematician

Biography

Maria Reiche Grosse-Neumann was a German-born Peruvian mathematician, archaeologist, and technical translator. She is known for her research into the Nazca Lines, which she first saw in 1941 together with American historian Paul Kosok. Known as the "Lady of the Lines", Reiche made the documentation, preservation and public dissemination of the Nazca Lines her life's work.

Katja Kipping

Born in

Germany

Years

1978-.. (age 46)

Occupations

politicianslavist

Biography

Katja Kipping is a German politician of The Left party. She was a member of the Bundestag representing Saxony from 2005 to 2021, a federal co-leader of The Left from 2012 to 2021 alongside Bernd Riexinger, and the Senator for Integration, Labour and Social Affairs in the Berlin state government from December 2021 to April 2023.

Michael Kretschmer

Born in

Germany

Years

1975-.. (age 49)

Occupations

politicianengineer

Biography

Michael Kretschmer is a German politician of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) who has been serving as Minister President of Saxony since December 2017. Since 2022, he has been one of four deputy chairs of the CDU, under the leadership of chairman Friedrich Merz.

Reiner Haseloff

Born in

Germany

Years

1954-.. (age 70)

Occupations

politicianphysicist

Biography

Reiner Haseloff is a German politician who serves as the Minister President of Saxony-Anhalt. On 9 October 2020, he was elected President of the Bundesrat. His one-year term started on 1 November 2020.

Stanislaw Tillich

Born in

Germany

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Stanislaw Tillich is a German politician of the CDU. He served as the 3rd Minister President of Saxony from 2008 to 2017. From 1 November 2015 until 31 October 2016, he was President of the Bundesrat and ex officio deputy to the President of Germany. Tillich is of Sorbian ethnicity and lives in Panschwitz-Kuckau (Pančicy-Kukow), which is 35 kilometres north-east of Dresden near Kamenz.

Karl Schmidt-Rottluff

Born in

Germany

Years

1884-1976 (aged 92)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

1905-1906 studied architecture

Occupations

sculptorlithographerillustratoruniversity teachergraphic artist

Biography

Karl Schmidt-Rottluff was a German expressionist painter and printmaker; he was one of the four founders of the artist group Die Brücke.

Evgeny Paton

Born in

France

Years

1870-1953 (aged 83)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1894

Occupations

engineerpoliticianuniversity teachercivil engineer

Biography

Professor Evgeny Oskarovich Paton was an engineer of the Russian Empire and Soviet Union of Ukrainian descent who established in 1934 the E. O. Paton Electric Welding Institute in Kyiv. Paton was a people's deputy of the Supreme Soviet of the Soviet Union (1946–1953). He was the father of Borys Paton.

Uwe Tellkamp

Born in

Germany

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

physician writernovelistphysicianscreenwriter

Biography

Uwe Tellkamp is a German writer and physician. He practised medicine until 2004. Before the fall of communism, he was enlisted in the National People's Army as a tank commander and imprisoned when he refused to break up a demonstration in October 1989. Until the fall of the German Democratic Republic shortly after, he was prohibited from studying medicine.

Lilia Skala

Born in

Austria

Years

1896-1994 (aged 98)

Occupations

stage actortelevision actorarchitectfilm actor

Biography

Lilia Skala was an Austrian-American architect and actress known for her role in the film Lilies of the Field (1963), for which she received critical acclaim and an Academy Award nomination. During her career, Skala was also nominated for two Golden Globe Awards and a Primetime Emmy Award.

Slavoljub Eduard Penkala

Born in

Slovakia

Years

1871-1922 (aged 51)

Occupations

engineerinventor

Biography

Slavoljub Eduard Penkala was a Croatian engineer and inventor of Dutch-Polish descent.

Maximilian Krah

Born in

Germany

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Occupations

politicianlawyer

Biography

Maximilian Krah is a German lawyer and self-described right-wing politician. He is serving as member of the European Parliament for Alternative for Germany.

Marco Wanderwitz

Years

1975-.. (age 49)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied jurisprudence

Occupations

politicianlawyer

Biography

Marco Wanderwitz is a German lawyer and politician of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU). From 2018 until 2021, he served as Parliamentary State Secretary in the government of Chancellor Angela Merkel.

Carsten Borchgrevink

Born in

Norway

Years

1864-1934 (aged 70)

Occupations

explorer

Biography

Carsten Egeberg Borchgrevink was a Norwegian polar explorer and a pioneer of Antarctic travel. He inspired Sir Robert Falcon Scott, Sir Ernest Shackleton, Roald Amundsen, and others associated with the Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration.

Martin Dulig

Born in

Germany

Years

1974-.. (age 50)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

1998-2004 studied pedagogy

Occupations

construction workerpolitician

Biography

Martin Dulig is a German politician for the Social Democratic Party (SPD). Until 20 December 2019, he was the Saxon State Minister of Labor and Traffic and Deputy Minister President of Saxony in the governments of Stanislaw Tillich III and Michael Kretschmer. On 20 December 2019, Michael Kretschmer appointed a new cabinet, with Dulig continuing his role as State Minister for Economy, which he has held since 13 November 2014, in the governments of Stanislaw Tillich III and Michael Kretschmer and he was appointed Second Deputy Minister of Saxony.

Dirk Hilbert

Born in

Germany

Years

1971-.. (age 53)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Dirk Hilbert is a German politician serving as the current Lord Mayor of Dresden, the capital city of Saxony, since Helma Orosz's resignation in 2015.

Albert Renger-Patzsch

Born in

Germany

Years

1897-1966 (aged 69)

Occupations

photographer

Biography

Albert Renger-Patzsch was a German photographer associated with the New Objectivity.

Jörg Urban

Born in

Germany

Years

1964-.. (age 60)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Jörg Urban is a German politician for the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party and is party leader of the AFD in Saxony. He has been a member of the Landtag of the Free State of Saxony since 2014. Under Urban's leadership, the Saxon AfD state association developed so strongly towards the right-wing, that the State Office for the Protection of the Constitution has classified and is monitoring the party as a "secure right-wing anti constitutional effort" in 2023. The party has been labeled as a Far-Right organization

Arnold Vaatz

Born in

Germany

Years

1955-.. (age 69)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

1976-1981 studied mathematics

Occupations

politician

Biography

Arnold Vaatz is a German politician of represents the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) who served as a member of the Bundestag from the state of Saxony from 1998 until 2021.

Reimund Neugebauer

Born in

Germany

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

university teacherengineer

Biography

Reimund Neugebauer is a German mechanical engineer and professor who has been working in the field of machine tools and forming processes. On 1 October 2012 he took office as the tenth President of the Fraunhofer Society, the largest research organization in Europe, from his predecessor Hans-Jörg Bullinger.

Julia Bonk

Born in

Germany

Years

1986-.. (age 38)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Julia Bonk is a former Left Party politician who served in the Landtag of Saxony from 2004 to 2014. Elected at age 18, she became the youngest member of a parliament in Germany.

Reinhard Höppner

Born in

Germany

Years

1948-2014 (aged 66)

Occupations

politicianliterary editormathematician

Biography

Reinhard Höppner was a German politician (SPD) and writer.

Theodor Pallady

Born in

Romania

Years

1871-1956 (aged 85)

Occupations

painter

Biography

Theodor Pallady was a Romanian painter.

Friedrich Weinbrenner

Born in

Germany

Years

1766-1826 (aged 60)

Occupations

urban planneruniversity teacherarchitectmaster builder

Biography

Friedrich Weinbrenner was a German architect and city planner admired for his mastery of classical style.

Josef Duchač

Born in

Czech Republic

Years

1938-.. (age 86)

Occupations

politicianengineer

Biography

Josef Duchač is a German politician (CDU).

Johann Andreas Schubert

Born in

Germany

Years

1808-1870 (aged 62)

Occupations

entrepreneuruniversity teacherbandleadercomposerengineer

Biography

Johann-Andreas Schubert was a German general engineer (Universalingenieur), designer and university lecturer.

Tina Punzel

Born in

Germany

Years

1995-.. (age 29)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied economics

Occupations

competitive diver

Biography

Tina Punzel is a German diver.

Erik von Frenckell

Born in

Finland

Years

1887-1977 (aged 90)

Occupations

sportspersonengineercivil servantpolitician

Biography

Erik von Frenckell was a Swedish-speaking Finnish nobleman, member of the Parliament of Finland, member of the International Olympic Committee and a vice president of the International Football Association FIFA.

Wilhelm Knabe

Born in

Germany

Years

1923-2021 (aged 98)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1946-1950

Occupations

university teacherpoliticianecologist

Biography

Wilhelm Knabe was a German ecologist, pacifist, civil servant and politician, remembered as a founding member of the Green Party in Germany, and a pioneer of conservation of the environment who shaped the party for decades.

Max Littmann

Born in

Germany

Years

1862-1931 (aged 69)

Occupations

architectuniversity teacher

Biography

Max Littmann was a German architect.

Friedrich Traun

Born in

Germany

Years

1876-1908 (aged 32)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

1895-1899 graduated with doctorate

Occupations

middle-distance runnersprintertennis playerathletics competitor

Biography

Friedrich Adolf "Fritz" Traun was a German athlete and tennis player. Born into a wealthy family, he participated in the 1896 Summer Olympics and won a gold medal in men's doubles. He committed suicide after being accused of fathering a child out of wedlock.

Werner Felfe

Born in

Germany

Years

1928-1988 (aged 60)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Werner Felfe was a German politician and high-ranking party functionary of the Socialist Unity Party (SED).

Rainer Ortleb

Born in

Germany

Years

1944-.. (age 80)

Occupations

university teacherpoliticianengineer

Biography

Rainer Ortleb is a German academic and politician.

Carl Enckell

Born in

Russia

Years

1876-1959 (aged 83)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Carl Johan Alexis Enckell was a Finnish politician, diplomat, officer and businessman.

Johann Georg von Soldner

Born in

Germany

Years

1776-1833 (aged 57)

Occupations

physicistastronomermathematician

Biography

Johann Georg von Soldner was a German physicist, mathematician and astronomer, first in Berlin and later in 1808 in Munich.

Stephan Kühn

Born in

Germany

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 2008

Occupations

politician

Biography

Stephan Kühn is a German politician of Alliance 90/The Greens who served as a member of the Bundestag from the state of Saxony from 2009 until 2020. Since 2020, he has been serving as part of the city administration of Dresden.

Herbert Seifert

Born in

Germany

Years

1907-1996 (aged 89)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1926-1931

Occupations

university teachermathematician

Biography

Herbert Karl Johannes Seifert was a German mathematician known for his work in topology.

Richard Konwiarz

Born in

Poland

Years

1883-1960 (aged 77)

Occupations

architectuniversity teacher

Biography

Richard Konwiarz was a German architect. He was born in Tschempin and died in Hanover.

Walter Andrae

Born in

Germany

Years

1875-1956 (aged 81)

Occupations

university teacherart historiananthropologistassyriologistarchaeologist

Biography

Walter Andrae was a German archaeologist and architect born near Leipzig.

Eduard Friedrich Eversmann

Born in

Germany

Years

1794-1860 (aged 66)

Occupations

naturalistuniversity teacherbotanistornithologistentomologist

Biography

Alexander Eduard Friedrich Eversmann was a Prussian biologist and explorer.

Steffen Heidrich

Born in

Germany

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

association football player

Biography

Steffen Heidrich is a German former professional footballer who played as an attacking midfielder.

Constanze Angela Krehl

Born in

Germany

Years

1956-.. (age 68)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Constanze Angela Krehl is a German politician who served as a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) from 1994 to 2022. She is a member of the Social Democratic Party, part of the Party of European Socialists.

Hansjoachim Walther

Born in

Poland

Years

1939-2005 (aged 66)

Occupations

university teacherpoliticianmathematician

Biography

Hansjoachim Walther was a German politician and mathematician. He was leader of the German Social Union, a right-wing party modelled after the Bavarian CSU, during the Wende, serving as their parliamentary leader in the Volkskammer. After German reunification, he was co-opted to the Bundestag and appointed as Minister for Special Affairs.

Abdulai Silá

Years

1958-.. (age 66)

Occupations

novelistengineerplaywright

Biography

Abdulai Silá, is a Guinea-Bissauan engineer, economist, social researcher and writer. He is the author of three novels: Eterna Paixão (1994), A Última Tragédia (1995) and Mistida (1997), the first of which was the first novel published in Guinea-Bissau.

Franz Dischinger

Born in

Germany

Years

1887-1953 (aged 66)

Occupations

civil engineeruniversity teacher

Biography

Franz Dischinger was a pioneering German civil and structural engineer, responsible for the development of the modern cable-stayed bridge. He was also a pioneer of the use of prestressed concrete, patenting the technique of external prestressing (where the prestressing bars or tendons are not encased in the concrete) in 1934.

Manfred Grund

Born in

Germany

Years

1955-.. (age 69)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

1976-1980 graduated with Diplom in electrical engineering

Occupations

politician

Biography

Manfred Grund is a German politician of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU).

Leon Sternbach

Born in

Ukraine

Years

1864-1940 (aged 76)

Occupations

classical philologistuniversity teacherphilologist

Biography

Leon Sternbach was a Polish philologist and classicist, professor at Jagiellonian University, and member of Polish Academy of Arts and Sciences.

Theophil Sprecher von Bernegg

Born in

Switzerland

Years

1850-1927 (aged 77)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied agricultural science and forestry

Occupations

military officerpolitician

Biography

Theophil Andreas Luzius Sprecher von Bernegg was a Swiss politician and military Chief of the General Staff (1905–1919).

Rudolf Friedrichs

Born in

Germany

Years

1892-1947 (aged 55)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Rudolf Friedrichs was a German politician who served as the Minister-President of Saxony in the German Democratic Republic from 1945 to his death.

Herbert Wagner

Born in

Germany

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Herbert Wagner is a German politician.

Julius Kühn

Born in

Germany

Years

1825-1910 (aged 85)

Occupations

university teacheragronomistbotanist

Biography

Julius Gotthelf Kühn was a German academic and agronomist and he was one of the pioneers of plant pathology. Kuhn's father was a land owner and he gained experience in agriculture and botany on his father's land. He was trained in Bonn, starting at age 30 and was awarded his doctorate, which focused on diseases of beet and canola at Leipzig. In 1862, he became a professor of agriculture at the University of Halle. Kuhn published more than 70 papers on mycology and plant pathology over the course of his career.

Martin Grothkopp

Born in

Germany

Years

1986-.. (age 38)

Occupations

athletics competitorbobsledder

Biography

Martin Grothkopp is a German bobsledder. He competed in the four-man event at the 2018 Winter Olympics, winning the gold medal.

Heinz Schlicke

Born in

Germany

Years

1912-2006 (aged 94)

Biography

Heinz Schlicke, German-born engineer and author, an Operation Paperclip scientist, and engineer at the Allen-Bradley Co. in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Gerhard Pohl

Born in

Germany

Years

1937-2012 (aged 75)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Gerhard Pohl was a German politician and a member of the East German CDU. He served as Minister of Economics from April to August 1990, in the cabinet of Lothar de Maizière.

Oliver Wehner

Born in

Germany

Years

1984-.. (age 40)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Oliver Wehner is a German politician (CDU). He is the member of the Saxon State Parliament from 2009.

Bernhard von Cotta

Born in

Germany

Years

1808-1879 (aged 71)

Occupations

writercartographeruniversity teacherbotanistgeologist

Biography

Carl Bernhard von Cotta, known as Bernhard von Cotta, was a German geologist.

Emil Winkler

Born in

Germany

Years

1835-1888 (aged 53)

Occupations

university teacherengineercivil engineer

Biography

Emil Winkler was a German civil engineer, professor with broad academic interest including engineering mechanics, railway engineering, bridge engineering. Emil Winkler was first to formulate and solve a problem of elastic beam on deformable foundation. The model of a beam on elastic foundation which assumes linear force-deflection relationship is known as Winkler Foundation.

Eleonore Trefftz

Born in

Germany

Years

1920-2017 (aged 97)

Occupations

physicist

Biography

Eleonore Trefftz was a German physicist known for her work on molecular and nuclear physics. She was appointed as a Scientific Member of the Max Planck Institute for Physics and Astrophysics in 1971.

Martin Böttger

Born in

Germany

Years

1947-.. (age 77)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Martin Böttger was a prominent civil rights activist in East Germany. He was a member of the Landtag of the Free State of Saxony from 1990 to 1994 and led the faction of Alliance '90/The Greens.

Johann Coaz

Born in

Belgium

Years

1822-1918 (aged 96)

Occupations

botanistcartographer

Biography

Johann Wilhelm Fortunat Coaz was a Swiss forester, topographer and mountaineer from Graubünden. In 1850 he made the first ascent of Piz Bernina, the highest mountain in the Eastern Alps. He also gave Piz Bernina its name, after the eponymous pass.

Alwin Walther

Born in

Germany

Years

1898-1967 (aged 69)

Occupations

university teacherengineermathematician

Biography

Alwin Oswald Walther was a German mathematician, engineer and professor. He is one of the pioneers of mechanical computing technology in Germany.

Reinhart Heinrich

Born in

Germany

Years

1946-2006 (aged 60)

Occupations

biophysicistuniversity teacherwriter

Biography

Reinhart Heinrich was a German biophysicist.

Günter Baumann

Born in

Germany

Years

1947-.. (age 77)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Günter Helmut Baumann is a German politician and member of the CDU. An engineer by profession, Baumann has been a member of the Christian Democratic Union (East Germany) since 1972 until that party merged with its West German counterpart in 1990. From 1990 to 1998 he served as the mayor of Jöhstadt. Since 1998, he has been a directly elected member of the Bundestag, representing the constituencies of Annaberg – Stollberg – Zschopau (1998-2002), Annaberg – Aue-Schwarzenberg (2002 - 2009) and Erzgebirgskreis I since 2009.

Bernhard Thalheim

Born in

Germany

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

engineercomputer scientistmathematicianuniversity teacher

Biography

Bernhard Karl Thalheim is a German computer scientist and professor of information systems engineering at the University of Kiel in Kiel, Germany. He is known for his work on conceptual modeling and its theoretical foundational contributions.

Günther Landgraf

Born in

Czech Republic

Years

1928-2006 (aged 78)

Occupations

university teacherphysicistpedagogue

Biography

Günther Landgraf was a German physicist and, from 1990 till 1994, President of Technische Universität Dresden.

Agnes Sjöberg

Born in

Finland

Years

1888-1964 (aged 76)

Occupations

veterinarian

Biography

Agnes Hildegard Sjöberg was a Finnish veterinarian. She graduated as a veterinarian and as the first woman in Europe and likely the first woman in the world to defend her PhD in veterinary medicine. During her career, Sjöberg worked as a municipal veterinarian in Somero and Närpes and held a private reception for a long time. Sjöberg was subjected to prejudice and discrimination by colleagues, and her pioneering work as a female veterinarian was not recognized until much after her death.

Amé Pictet

Born in

Switzerland

Years

1857-1937 (aged 80)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1877-1879

Occupations

chemistuniversity teacher

Biography

Amé Pictet was a Swiss chemist. He discovered the Pictet–Spengler reaction, and the related Pictet–Hubert reaction and Pictet–Gams reaction.

Walter Polakov

Born in

Russia

Years

1879-1948 (aged 69)

Occupations

mechanical engineer

Biography

Walter Nicholas Polakov was a mechanical engineer, consulting engineer, and pioneer of scientific management.

Arthur Meinig

Born in

Germany

Years

1853-1904 (aged 51)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1875

Occupations

architect

Biography

Arthur Meinig was a Kingdom of Saxony-born architect from Austria-Hungary. He was born in Waldheim, Saxony on 7 November 1853 and died in Budapest on 14 September 1904. After studying in Dresden, he worked for architects Fellner and Helmer in Vienna. In 1883 he moved to Budapest and soon became the favorite architect of Hungarian aristocracy. He created buildings in the styles of Neo-Gothic, Neo-Renaissance, and especially in Neobaroque.

Carl Theodor Albrecht

Born in

Germany

Years

1843-1915 (aged 72)

Occupations

surveyorastronomer

Biography

Carl Theodor Albrecht was a German astronomer.

Hans Hübner

Born in

Germany

Years

1837-1884 (aged 47)

Occupations

chemistuniversity teacher

Biography

Hans Hübner was a German chemist. He was the son of painter Julius Hübner (1806–1882).

Wilhelm Flügge

Born in

Germany

Years

1904-1990 (aged 86)

Enrolled in the Dresden University of Technology

Studied in 1921-1927

Occupations

aerospace engineerengineercivil engineer

Biography

Gottfried Wilhelm Flügge was a German engineer, and Professor of Applied Mechanics at Stanford University. He is known as recipient of the 1970 Theodore von Karman Medal in Engineering Mechanics, and the 1970 Worcester Reed Warner Medal.

Victoria Angelova

Born in

Bulgaria

Years

1902-1947 (aged 45)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Victoria Angelova Vinarova was one of the first female architects of Bulgaria. She is credited with having built the first modern, national art gallery in the Balkans.

William Dunkel

Born in

United States

Years

1893-1980 (aged 87)

Occupations

architectuniversity teacher

Hans Dresig

Germany

Rudolph Hering

Born in

United States

Years

1847-1923 (aged 76)

Occupations

chemistcivil engineer

Biography

Rudolph Hering was a founder of modern environmental technology.

Hellmut Schmid

Born in

Germany

Years

1914-1998 (aged 84)

Occupations

surveyoruniversity teacher

Biography

Hellmut H. Schmid was a Swiss professor of geodesy and photogrammetry. He taught at ETH Zürich (Switzerland). In the 1950s, he worked on space exploration in the United States. Between 1968 and 1974, he promoted the first intercontinental network of satellite geodesy.

Sergej Flach

Born in

Germany

Occupations

theoretical physicist

Biography

Sergej Flach is a theoretical physicist whose research has spanned a number of scientific fields in his career. With about 240 publications to his name, his research has been cited over 16,000 times giving him an h-index of 58 and i10-index of 174. He is a member of the American Physical Society, German Physical Society, Korean Physical Society, and New Zealand Institute of Physics. He is an editorial board member of Chaos (2016-) and was an editorial board member of Physical Review E (2009-2011).

Olav Heggstad

Born in

Norway

Years

1877-1954 (aged 77)

Occupations

civil engineer

Biography

Olav Heggstad was a Norwegian civil engineer and professor at the Norwegian Institute of Technology.

Klaus Jacob

Born in

Czech Republic

Years

1943-.. (age 81)

Occupations

rower

Biography

Klaus Jacob is a German rower who competed for East Germany in the 1968 Summer Olympics.

Frederick William Cappelen

Born in

Norway

Years

1857-1921 (aged 64)

Occupations

civil engineerengineer

Biography

Frederick William Cappelen was a Norwegian-born architect and civil engineer who held the office of Minneapolis City Engineer.

Hassa Horn

Born in

Norway

Years

1873-1968 (aged 95)

Occupations

engineerarchitectpoliticianNordic combined skier

Biography

Hans Thomas "Hassa" Horn was a Norwegian road engineer, industrialist, sports official and politician for the Conservative Party.

Jens Dunker

Born in

Norway

Years

1892-1981 (aged 89)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Jens Gram Dunker was a Norwegian architect. He was noted for his work in the transition between neo-classicism and functionalism in Norwegian architecture. Dunker made significant contributions to Norwegian functionalism through different types of buildings: townhouses, housing blocks, townhouses, villas, theaters and hotels.

Peter Østbye

Born in

Norway

Years

1855-1943 (aged 88)

Occupations

philologisttranslator

Biography

Peter Nielsen Østbye was a Norwegian philologist and academic administrator. He taught classical languages and was a proponent of learning the Latin language. He was an education official at Fredrikstad between 1894-1910 and at Drammen between 1910-1926. He is principally known for his translations of Homer's epic poems, the Iliad and the Odyssey from Ancient Greek into Norwegian.

Biography

Augustin Thoresen Paus was a Norwegian engineer and industrial leader who played a key role in hydropower development in Norway through the first half of the 20th century. He graduated as an officer from the Military Academy and as a civil engineer from Dresden, starting his engineering career at Norsk Hydro as an associate of Sam Eyde during the development of the Rjukan industrial facilities. From 1918, he led the construction of the hydroelectric Rånåsfoss power plant, one of the largest in Europe. Upon its completion in 1922, he became the first managing director of Akershus elektrisitetsverk (now Akershus Energi), a position he held until his death. He was described as the "absolute ruler" of the industrial community that emerged at Rånåsfoss. He also held several other positions in the Norwegian power industry and was described as "one of the most prominent leaders in the Norwegian energy industry." He served as chairman of Glommens og Laagens Brukseierforening, Foreningen Samkjøringen—the precursor to the Nordic electricity exchange Nord Pool—the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History, and several power companies.

Biography

Bernhard Cornelius Brænne was a Norwegian factory owner and member of the Norwegian Parliament with the Conservative Party.
